designations.source: A review of the status of Larger Brachycera flies of Great Britain
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the threat status of Larger Brachycera flies last undertaken in 1991, using a more modern IUCN methodology for assessing threat
designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Taxa which are neither threatened nor near threatened.
designations.comments: Recorded from 13 hectads since 1990 and showing no real decline, and a moderately large proportion of old and recent hectads in common, indicating that some populations may be stable. The species nearly qualifies as Near Threatened (11-12 locations) but the distribution is scattered in the southeast of England (one south Welsh record) which suggests that the species is not confined to a single habitat (although most records are from coastal freshwater grazing marsh). Moved beyond NR under Criterion 2 and 7.
